page.title: 11ST. MARKS SCHOOL
page.content: St. Mark's (voluntary aided) Church in Wales School is situated on two and a half acres of land to the south of Haverfordwest. It was opened Jan.1982. The permanent teachers must be members of the church and any applying for a job must have two spokesmen one being the parish priest. The Comminity Council of Merlin's Bridge,where the school is situated, elect one school governor. Govenors look after the school and its well being. The twelve members at the governing board must have six foundation governors,ones involved with,or are practising members of the Church. The school has 8 classes and has an age range from 4 to 12 years with a total of 214 children. These are in 3 infant and 2 junior classes and a special slow learners class.
